DataElement.preferredName: Disease Progression Relapse Location Anatomic Site Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The named locations related to disease progression or relapse location or site within the body.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to disease progression or relapse location or site.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cancer that continues to grow or spread.

Concepts.definition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

Property.preferredDefinition: The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

Concepts.definition: The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.
A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Disease Progression Relapse Anatomic Site Name
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The named locations of the worsening of a disease over time or the return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymph node that drains lymph from a region of interest.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node that drains lymph from a region of interest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The tissue that lines the wall of the thoracic cavity and the surface of the lungs.

Concepts.definition: The tissue that lines the wall of the thoracic cavity and the surface of the lungs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A conical membranous sac filled with serous fluid in which the heart as well as the roots of the aorta and other large blood vessels are contained.

Concepts.definition: A conical membranous sac filled with serous fluid in which the heart as well as the roots of the aorta and other large blood vessels are contained.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A fold of peritoneum originating at the stomach and supporting the viscera.

Concepts.definition: A fold of peritoneum originating at the stomach and supporting the viscera.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any one of three membranes that surround the brain and spinal cord.

Concepts.definition: Any one of three membranes that surround the brain and spinal cord.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the two bean-shaped organs located on each side of the spine in the retroperitoneum. The right kidney is located below the liver and the left kidney below the diaphragm. The kidneys filter and secret the metabolic products and minerals from the blood, thus maintaining the homeostasis. On the superior pole of each kidney there is an adrenal gland. Each kidney and adrenal gland is surrounded by fat.

Concepts.definition: One of the two bean-shaped organs located on each side of the spine in the retroperitoneum. The right kidney is located below the liver and the left kidney below the diaphragm. The kidneys filter and secrete metabolic products and minerals from the blood, thus maintaining homeostasis. On the superior pole of each kidney there is an adrenal gland. Each kidney and adrenal gland is surrounded by fat.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to a neck, or cervix, in any sense.

Concepts.definition: Relating to a neck, or cervix, in any sense.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: On or relating to the opposite side of the body.: One of the two bean-shaped organs located on each side of the spine in the retroperitoneum. The right kidney is located below the liver and the left kidney below the diaphragm. The kidneys filter and secret the metabolic products and minerals from the blood, thus maintaining the homeostasis. On the superior pole of each kidney there is an adrenal gland. Each kidney and adrenal gland is surrounded by fat.

Concepts.definition: On or relating to the opposite side of the body.

One of the two bean-shaped organs located on each side of the spine in the retroperitoneum. The right kidney is located below the liver and the left kidney below the diaphragm. The kidneys filter and secrete metabolic products and minerals from the blood, thus maintaining homeostasis. On the superior pole of each kidney there is an adrenal gland. Each kidney and adrenal gland is surrounded by fat.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the body that lies between the thorax and the pelvis.: Not characterized in any other way.

Concepts.definition: The cavity located between the lungs and pelvis. It contains the lower esophagus, stomach, pancreas, intestines, liver, gallbladder and spleen.
Not characterized in any other way.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A flattened, roughly triangular body resting upon the upper end of each kidney; it is one of the ductless glands furnishing internal secretions (epinephrine and norepinephrine from the medulla and steroid hormones from the cortex).

Concepts.definition: A flattened, roughly triangular body resting upon the upper end of each kidney; it is one of the ductless glands furnishing internal secretions (epinephrine and norepinephrine from the medulla and steroid hormones from the cortex).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans.

Concepts.definition: The bony, basin-shaped structure formed by the hipbones and the base of the backbone supporting the lower limbs in humans.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 01/29/2015.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

Concepts.definition: The part of the nervous system that consists of the brain, spinal cord, and meninges.
An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Refers to muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, blood vessels, or other supporting tissue of the body.

Concepts.definition: A general term comprising tissue that is not hardened or calcified; including muscle, fat, blood vessels, nerves, tendons, ligaments and fascia.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.: A characteristic that can be objectively measured and serves as an indicator for normal biologic processes, pathogenic processes, state of health or disease, the risk for disease development and/or prognosis, or responsiveness to a particular therapeutic intervention.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.

A characteristic that can be objectively measured and serves as an indicator for normal biologic processes, pathogenic processes, state of health or disease, the risk for disease development and/or prognosis, or responsiveness to a particular therapeutic intervention.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

Concepts.definition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ that is part of the lymphatic system. The spleen produces lymphocytes, filters the blood, stores blood cells, and destroys old blood cells. It is located on the left side of the abdomen near the stomach.

Concepts.definition: An organ that is part of the hematopoietic and immune systems. It is composed of the white pulp and the red pulp and is surrounded by a capsule. It is located in the left hypochondriac region. Its functions include lymphocyte production, blood cell storage, and blood cell destruction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pea-sized endocrine gland located at the base of the brain in the pituitary fossa. It produces and secretes hormones such as oxytocin and vasopressin, to regulate the activities of the hypothalamus.

Concepts.definition: Pea-sized endocrine gland located at the base of the brain in the pituitary fossa. It produces and secretes hormones such as oxytocin and vasopressin, to regulate the activities of the hypothalamus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

Concepts.definition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The wedge-shaped bone consisting of five fused vertebrae, S1-S5 in man, forming the posterior part of the pelvis; its base connects with the lowest lumbar vertebra and its tip with the coccyx.

Concepts.definition: The triangular bone, made up of 5 fused bones of the spine, located in the lower area of the spine between the fifth lumbar vertebra and the coccyx.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The back of the abdomen where the kidneys lie and the great blood vessels run.

Concepts.definition: The back of the abdomen where the kidneys lie and the great blood vessels run.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A group of organs surrounded by loose connective tissue, separating the two pleural sacs, between the sternum anteriorly and the vertebral column posteriorly as well as from the thoracic inlet superiorly to the diaphragm inferiorly. The mediastinum contains the heart and pericardium, the bases of the great vessels, the trachea and bronchi, esophagus, thymus, lymph nodes, thoracic duct, phrenic and vagus nerves, and other structures and tissues.

Concepts.definition: An anatomic site along the midline and under the sternum that contains the heart and pericardium, the bases of the great vessels, the trachea and bronchi, esophagus, thymus, lymph nodes, thoracic duct, phrenic and vagus nerves, and other structures and tissues.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

Concepts.definition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The last portion of the vertebral column just below the sacrum consisting of 3-5 rudimentary vertebrae.

Concepts.definition: A small bone located at the bottom of the spine. The coccyx is a result of 3-5 fused rudimentary vertebrae.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.: The tissue that constitutes the essential part of an organ as contrasted with e.g., connective tissue and blood vessels.

Concepts.definition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.
The tissue that constitutes the essential part of an organ as contrasted with e.g., connective tissue and blood vessels.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/03/2015.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

Concepts.definition: The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The worsening of a disease over time.:The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.:Named locations of or within the body.:The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.
The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.
Named locations of or within the body.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
